MOM - MECHANICAL OPERATIONS MANUAL

DARK MODE

OPERATIONAL OBJECTIVE

Resource Planning Equipment

To effectively plan, track, and manage equipment resources throughout the project lifecycle, ensuring optimal utilization, cost control, and timely availability of equipment to support project activities.

ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES

Who Is Involved

• Site Superintendent – Overall responsibility for equipment planning and management

• Equipment Coordinator – Day-to-day equipment tracking and coordination

• Project Manager/PE – Support with equipment budgeting and procurement

• Task Leaders – Identifying task-specific equipment needs

• Senior/General Superintendent – Oversight of equipment allocation across projects/Track budget throughout project lifecycle

RESOURCES NEEDED

What You Need to Begin

• Project schedule and build sequence

• Equipment estimates from project budget

• Power BI dashboard resource planning data

• Task-specific equipment requirements

• Equipment specifications

• Ensure equipment is rated appropriately for the activity

• Ensure delivered equipment complies with current Moss safety standards

• Equipment availability information (based on location)

STEP-BY-STEP INSTRUCTIONS

Executing the Process

This section outlines the standard procedure for managing project equipment allocation, scheduling, and tracking. The steps below ensure that actual onsite equipment aligns with project needs, orders are adjusted accordingly, deliveries are coordinated, and utilization is properly documented and coded.

01

Access the MechTech dashboard and review equipment schedule

Access the MechTech dashboard and review equipment schedule

02

Compare actual equipment onsite against the planned allocation

Compare actual equipment onsite against the planned allocation

03

Make adjustments to equipment orders based on project needs and schedule

Make adjustments to equipment orders based on project needs and schedule

04

Coordinate equipment deliveries and call-offs with vendors and the equipment coordinator

Coordinate equipment deliveries and call-offs with vendors and the equipment coordinator

05

Document any deviations from the equipment plan and their justifications

Document any deviations from the equipment plan and their justifications

06

Monitor that all equipment is coded appropriately based on task utilization

Monitor that all equipment is coded appropriately based on task utilization

TIMING & TRIGGERS

When This Should Occur

• Initial equipment planning during pre-mobilization phase

• Weekly meetings with Equipment Coordinator to review allocations and budgetary constraints

• Equipment adjustments based on project progress and schedule changes

• Equipment call-offs as tasks are completed

FILE STORAGE

Where This Output Is Stored

• MechTech dashboard

• SharePoint > [Project Folder] > 15. Metrics > Equipment > Equipment Tracking Log

• Site Superintendent's files

APPROVAL & REVIEW

Who Reviews and Approves

Site Superintendent – Primary review and approval of equipment plans

Equipment Coordinator – Regular monitoring and reporting

Senior/General Superintendent – Oversight and approval of significant deviations from plan/Tracking equipment budget

REFERENCE MATERIAL

Where to Find Supporting Guides and Trainings

  1. [Include link for step-by-step instructions for checking MechTech dash (picture guide)]

ADDITIONAL NOTES

Important Considerations

• The equipment schedule is based on project estimates and should be reviewed regularly

• Site superintendents should make sound judgment calls when ordering additional equipment beyond estimates

• Equipment utilization should be maximized to control project costs

• Coordinate with other project sites for potential equipment sharing when possible
